title: Court puts reinstatement of cannabis commission head on hold
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Judge orders Cannabis Control Commission Chair Shannon O'Brien to be reinstated after wrongful removal ruling.
State Treasurer Deborah Goldberg appeals ruling, delaying O'Brien's return, citing alleged misconduct and inappropriate remarks.
O'Brien's lawyers must respond to the appeal by Wednesday; her term expires August 31, 2027.

title: Man charged with murder after woman, 38, found dead in Lynn, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: A 38-year-old woman was found dead early Sunday on Newhall Street in Lynn.
A 30-year-old Lynn man has been charged with murder, according to Essex County DA Paul Tucker.
The suspect is scheduled for arraignment Monday morning in Lynn District Court; identities remain undisclosed.

title: Jakobi Meyers shuts down questions about trade request: ‘Happy to be a Raider’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers affirms commitment to Raiders despite trade request, happy with team's win over the Patriots.
Meyers negotiated a new contract with Raiders, in the final year of his 3-year, $33 million deal.
Raiders, under new head coach Pete Carroll, start 2025 season strong after 2024 struggles.

title: Tornado confirmed in Mass. town as powerful storm sweeps over region
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A tornado touched down in Holden, Massachusetts during Saturday's storm, confirmed by the National Weather Service.
Severe weather included tornado warnings across much of Massachusetts, excluding the area east of Stow.
The storm caused damage and power outages in areas like Paxton and Holyoke, but no injuries were reported.

title: In a season promising change, the 2025 Patriots looked all too familiar in season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots lost their 2025 season opener to the Raiders 20-13, showing familiar issues despite offseason changes.
New coach Mike Vrabel's team struggled with penalties and execution, notably in the second half against Las Vegas.
Quarterback Drake Maye showed promise early but was hindered by turnovers and offensive line issues in the second half.

title: Will Campbell’s NFL debut was solid until things began to unravel late in the second half
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookie Will Campbell struggled in his NFL debut with two false starts and involvement in two sacks against the Raiders.
Campbell admitted mistakes and took full accountability, vowing to improve after New England's 20-13 loss to Las Vegas.
Despite late-game issues, Raiders' Maxx Crosby praised Campbell's potential and future under Coach Josh McDaniels.

title: Lynn police officer on leave after becoming ‘suddenly incapacitated’ while on duty
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A Lynn police officer was placed on leave after a video showed him incapacitated during a traffic stop.
The department suspects a medical episode and is investigating all potential contributing factors.
The video shows the officer unresponsive and struggling, with accusations from a bystander about possible substance influence.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots lost 20-13 to the Raiders in their season opener at Gillette Stadium, marking the start of Mike Vrabel's era.
Harold Landry III excelled defensively with 2.5 sacks, while Kayshon Boutte led the team in receptions and receiving yards.
Running backs struggled with only 60 rushing yards as a team, and kicker Andy Borregales missed a crucial 40-yard field goal.

title: Review & setlist: Dropkick Murphys come on strong, avert disaster at soggy Suffolk Downs
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Dropkick Murphys overcame adverse weather at Suffolk Downs, resuming their set post rain delay during the Seisiún festival.
The audience dwindled due to a storm, but those who stayed enjoyed energetic performances from Dropkick Murphys and The Hold Steady.
Dropkick Murphys performed tracks like "The Boys Are Back" and debuted "The Green Fields Of France (No Man’s Land)" live.

title: Bill Belichick explains ‘simple’ reason why he decided to ban Patriots scout at UNC
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick banned a Patriots scout from UNC practices, citing mutual unwelcome sentiments.
Belichick and the Patriots have developed a tense relationship since his departure in 2023.
Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel stated they will find alternative ways to scout UNC players.
